headline: Salt and Pepper Skillet Fries
description: Pan fry potatoes in a skillet with hot olive oil and butter to make simple and delicious fries seasoned with sea salt and coarse black pepper.
name: Salt and Pepper Skillet Fries
recipeIngredient: 3 large potatoes, sliced lengthwise into 1/2-inch circles and cut into 1/2-inch strips

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil and butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook and stir potato strips in hot oil mixture until browned on all sides, 20 to 25 minutes.
Transfer fries to a paper towel-lined plate; season with sea salt and cracked black pepper.

review.reviewBody: These were actually so good! I decided to leave the skin on the potatoes and it was really good like that, I'll definitely make these again!

We had these with fried shrimp and they were perfect. I held them in a 200 degree oven on a cookie sheet while we fixed the shrimp. So good. The were like a cross between a French fry and fried potatoes. Love the taste and the addition of butter. My husband said we will be having these again instead of regular fried potatoes. There is a definite difference between fried taters and these with butter. Will also try with peanut oil and butter.
So good the longer and crisper the better so easy to make and delicious
Good basic recipe.
Delicious and easy to make.

Great recipe! I tweaked it a bit with the seasonings and added some garlic powder and doubled the ingidients because I was planning to make alot. It's so easy, but I have one tip. You should use alot more oil so you can make the frying process quicker. Especially if you cut your potatoes thicker. I hope y'all enjoy eating and making these!

Wasn't a fan of these overall. Seemed more like greasy home fries. I precut my potatoes and kept in cold water until I was ready to cook them. Dried the potatoes thoroughly and proceeded with the recipe. It definitely does not take 20-25 minutes per batch to fry. I did drain on paper towels and they seemed to crisp more, but then seemed a bit soggy/limp after. Maybe I did something wrong? Sorry, but this simply wasn't for us.

Made this 7/17/19 to use up some red potatoes that were starting to get soft. I didn't measure the oil or butter--just eyeballed both and put in what I thought would be half as I was only going to cook so many of the potatoes I had pared and cut up. They turned out pretty well. I put a lid on the pan and set the timer in 5-minute increments so I could check on them and flipped them about halfway through. I didn't have the cracked pepper or coarse sea salt so just used regular salt and pepper (although I normally don't put pepper on potatoes). Will make these again.
I added a teaspoon of garlic during the last 5 minutes of cooking. Delicious and so easy to prepare.
Very good. Works well with spiced oil. You don't really need the butter, but you can add it if you want. We added a tablespoon. Very quick to cook, faster than expected. Overall very enjoyable.
hella good

Have made same using Store bought "Steak Fries" originally instructed 2 B prepared in an oven, however, chose 2 warm in microwave, transfer 2 skillet w/ spritzed olive oil, garlic & black pepper mix & slowly pan fry then added salt 2 taste & freshly diced portabella mushrooms 2-3 min before removing from pan. (Alt., thin 2 med strips of Swiss cheese, or your fav. cheese! casually draped across the now DELIRIOUSLY delicious steak fries!!) ENJOY W/ a Juicy Sirloin Burner w/ the works!!! . . . :)
Basically fried potatoes.
The hardest part was cutting up the potatoes! Will definitely make again!
THIS IS THE WAY MY MOTHER MADE THEM, BUT WE ADD DICED ONION TO THEM---WOW
Used peanut oil to cook. Delicious
Wonderful.
made these for hubs with his tbone. I asked him for $15 for dinner as a joke he said "it's worth more than that. I would happily pay $30!" followed by "delicious dinner!"
Turned out excellent, family wanted it again in less then three days. I also used more butter.
Great late night snack. I never make enough tho lol!

These turned out great and I will definitely be making them again. It was harder than deep fried fries and I had to turn them all individually and keep watch over them to get evenly cooked sides. I had some confusion understanding how to cut the potato into 1/2 inch circles. My husband didn't like these at all but he isn't a french fry fan. I loved them and made 3 potatoes for the 2 of us and it was just right. Thanks Miskyn, these were great!

Made these in our cast iron skillet while camping, nice and tasty and easy for two people. Made again and used red potatoes, seemed to cook faster with red potatoes, although I didn't time it. You do need to keep stirring to evenly cook and I got pretty hot doing that...much better cooking outdoors.
Delicious and crispy. I only made 1 potato and it only cooked for about 15 minutes.
Really nice worth a try ^_^
I started off using the olive oil/butter but decided to refill with peanut oil. These were delicious and easy - it didn't take 20 mins for each batch.
Perfect stovetop fries. I usually like to roast my potatoes but this will be the recipe I reach for when I want them fried on the stove. Thanks so much for posting :)
I made these with Red Potatoes and they worked great. Need to adjust the temp so they cook with burning. Thankfully I like my fries crispier than most.

These turned out really great! I used to bake our homemade fries but in the summer when it's hot & I don't want to heat up the oven I was looking for an easy stovetop version. I found this recipe and I like it even better!!

I made these in my cast iron skillet and used a full tablespoon of butter. They were wonderful! I had a rare evening with just 3 of us to cook for and this was easy enough. I don't think I would make this for the whole family (7 of us and teenagers who eat like there is no tomorrow) as it would take a lot of time standing at the stove working in batches.
Very quick & easy!

We all LOVED these! I did use 1 tablespoon of butter instead of 1 teaspoon, and more salt and pepper than called for, to taste. I was so happy with how crispy ans tasty these turned out. The family is already asking when I'm gonna make them again...A definite keeper~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
